what: Query Military Expenditure Data From SIPRI

what: Getting Military Expenditure in constant USD
title: Query Military Expenditure Data From SIPRI
text: query data, military expenditure constant USD. available indicators :
code: library(milRex) data <- sipri_get_data(indicator = "constantUSD",                      cache = TRUE,                     verbose = FALSE,                     footnotes = FALSE)

title: Query Military Expenditure Data From SIPRI
text: Military Expenditure concept difficult measure adequately comparative manner across globe. dataset SIPRI best effort exists today, using open sources. Nonetheless, limitation data. highly encourage anyone wants use dataset, read Sources Methods section : https://www.sipri.org/databases/milex/sources--methods

title: Query Military Expenditure Data From SIPRI
text: SIPRI estimates reported dataset marked uncertain estimations (e.g. data China). cells marked blue red resulting excel-file. Unfortunately, color coding machine-readable, hence information translated data.frames R missing. Please aware limitation.

title: Query Military Expenditure Data From SIPRI
text: Stockholm International Peace Research Institute limits copying redistribution data following two use-cases: excerption SIPRI copyrighted material purposes criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship research use non-commercial purposes reproduction less 10 per cent published data set. Hence, package contain SIPRI data . merely automatizes access website, making corresponding POST request cleaning resulting xlsx file tidy formats. Please make sure cite SIPRI using data : SIPRI Military Expenditure Database 2024, https://www.sipri.org/databases/milex
